definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
Zhonglou district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
bell tower/campanile/clock tower/Bell Tower, historic attraction in Xian, Beijing etc
Zhonglou district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
bell tower/campanile/clock tower/Bell Tower, historic attraction in Xian, Beijing etc
Zhongshan district of Liupanshui city 六盤水市|六盘水市[Liu4 pan2 shui3 shi4], Guizhou/Zhongshan county in Hezhou 賀州|贺州[He4 zhou1], Guangxi
set of bells (old Chinese music instrument)

sentences.english: Consequently, you will find that almost every one owns either a watch or a clock.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你會發現幾乎每個人都擁有一隻表或一個鐘。

sentences.english: How still the bells in steeples stand.
What did it produce? The cuckoo clock.
A floor under the bells of an open belfry .
sentences.chinese: 在露天鐘樓的鐘下面的那一層板。

sentences.english: Conductive Keratoplasty (CK) can turn back the clock on farsightedness, but it cannot stop the clock.
sentences.chinese: CK雖可回撥遠視的時鐘，但它不能使這時鐘停下來。

sentences.english: The church bell clashed its melancholy note.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的鐘敲出悲涼的調子。

sentences.english: Even the bell in Independence Hall was rung.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連獨立大廳的鐘也敲響了。

sentences.english: Ring the bell of the present, and you will hear the distant echoes of the infinite past and future.
sentences.chinese: 敲響當下的鐘，你會聽到遙遠的過去和未來的回聲。

sentences.english: The Bronze Ever-ringing Bell functions as a constant reminder of the tragically heroic period in history.
sentences.chinese: 這口銅製的長鳴鐘警示我們要記住這段悲壯的歷史。

sentences.english: There is a sonorous bell in the tower.
The hands on the office clock seemed to be weighted down.
sentences.chinese: 辦公室裏鐘的指針好像加了重壓一樣。

sentences.english: Have a Zhong Nashan only, doesn't the society sense awkwardness and danger?
sentences.chinese: 只有一個鐘南山，社會難道不感到尷尬和危險？

sentences.english: 'What hour?'asked the Rat worriedly , looking at the clock on the wall.
sentences.chinese: “什麼時辰？”水鼠擔心的問，看著牆上的鐘。

sentences.english: There is a clock , two blackboards in our classroom.
sentences.chinese: 我們教室有一個鐘，兩塊黑板。

sentences.english: It is still fair to think of the solar system as a kind of gigantic clock.
sentences.chinese: 把太陽系當成一隻巨大的鐘，也未嘗不可。

sentences.english: The first bell started to ring,and then the others chimed in.
sentences.chinese: 第一個鐘聲響起，其他鐘接着奏出和諧的樂聲。

definition: handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
